results.title: The Troop grows
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: This film is not intended for public promotional purposes, but is aimed at the Scoutmaster, in the belief that he is the key to a successful recruiting program. The film serves as an introduction, telling the story of how one scoutmaster solved his particular problems, discovering that they were tied up together with good program and boy leadership.

results.title: The Triple jump
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”
The technique of the triple jump, sometimes known as the hop, step and jump, is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Training and preparation techniques for achieving success in this event from the beginner stage are also shown.

results.title: The Trip (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Louie is lonely when he moves out of his neighbourhood - so he constructs an imaginary world in a shoe box and flies off in his toy plane to visit old friends. The adventure helps Louie discover that friends are friends wherever you are. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats. Narrated by Charles Turner.

results.title: The Triangular arm splint
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “First Aid for Fractures”
Demonstrates step by step how to apply a triangular arm splint, and shows how it is employed in combination with a single padded basswood splint for fractures of the upper or lower arm.

results.title: The Trials of Franz Kafka
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Harold Mantell Inc and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the trials of childhood, youth, and tragic adulthood which Kafka described in his novels and stories, photographed in the author’s native Prague. Displays an understanding of modern man’s anxiety and alienation. English version adapted by Harold Mantell Inc. Narrated by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: The Tree. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Michael Ahnemann, Edward Schuman and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: This film describes the beauty of trees and their importance to birds, insects, other plants, animals and people. It introduces the interdependence of living things. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Tree. - 1st ed.
results.creator_credit: Michael Murphy, Churchill Films and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: This film describes the beauty of trees, and introduces simple ideas of ecology. Living things depend on each other; a tree is important to the community of birds, insects, plants and animals living around it. Written by Edward Schuman. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Tree outside my house
results.brief_description:
The concept of the project was to represent the process of establishing data. The data was established as a set of 20 facts about the tree outside my house. The representations of the processes were to be strongly associated with my memories of learning and using these processes.
Initially the concept of the project only dealt with the
visualisation of the height of the tree and the process to
establish that fact. The visualisation of this process was to
be based on my childhood memories of a school activity.
The initial concept was later widened to include 20 facts
about the tree.
I was more interested in the processes used to establish
the facts than the facts themselves. I wanted to explore my memories and visually represent the process as a memory. The processes I wanted to represent were tied to the following facts:
•The name of the tree
•The botanical name of the tree
•The distance from the tree
•The angle to the top of the tree
•The height equals distance multiplied by pi
•The height of the tree
•The width of the trunk
•The volume of the tree
•The age of the tree
•The colour of the bark in RGB
•The colour of the bark in hexadecimal
•The bark’s range and difference of colours
•The shape of the leaves
•The colour of the leaves
•The size of the leaves
•The area of the leaves
•The noise of the wind in the leaves of the tree
•The number of branches
•The location of the tree
